Overall I like almost everything about this game. The mythology and the familiar crossovers are specifically cool. I like the randomness less. It makes it difficult to build a specific or 'complete' team even after spending a notable amount of time and money.

At first I was very skeptical, the youtube ads didn't really make for the best encouragement to play it, but one day I started. It's been 4 years I've been playing this game. I love the fact it's multi-platform, I like very often updates, this game changed so much throughout the years due to the fact more complicated and interested mechanics and COOL champions were introduced. But most of all - I made friends along the way. I've been in 3 clans including the one I'm in now. Each one had the best leadership and other folk were there to always help, not necessarily only about the game. This game has, I think still, bad rep - of course, it is at the end of the day in the very very highest endgame a pay 2 win title - fact is, that most of the players don't aim for the highest ranks in the leaderboards, most of my clanmates are f2p and this game is totally playable this way. It's a one of a kind game - I truly recommend trying it out, multiplatform makes it easier, and getting into a clan is, in my experience, the most fun addition.
I like this game, but the downside is that my previous account was not valid and I had to create a new one, but I like everything anyway :D

I'll throw in a recipe for Varenyky.

Recipe for Potato Dumplings (Varenyky)
Ingredients:
For the dough:
Wheat flour ‚Äì 500 g
Water ‚Äì 200 ml
Egg ‚Äì 1
Salt ‚Äì 1 tsp
For the filling:
Potatoes ‚Äì 1 kg
Onions ‚Äì 2
Lard or butter ‚Äì 50 g
Salt ‚Äì to taste
Ground black pepper ‚Äì to taste
Preparation steps:
Making the dough:
Sifting the flour: Sift the flour into a large bowl.
Making the dough: Add salt and the egg to the flour. Gradually pour in the water, constantly stirring. Knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic.
Resting the dough: Wrap the dough in plastic wrap or cover it with a towel and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Preparing the filling:
Boiling the potatoes: Peel the potatoes, cut them into large pieces, and boil until tender in salted water.
Preparing the onions: While the potatoes are boiling, finely chop the onions. Saut√© the onions in lard or butter until golden brown.
Making the potato puree: Drain the potatoes and mash them. Add the saut√©ed onions, salt, and pepper to taste, and mix well.
Forming the dumplings:
Rolling out the dough: Roll out the dough into a thin sheet about 2-3 mm thick. Use a glass or cutter to cut out circles approximately 7-8 cm in diameter.
Forming the dumplings: Place a spoonful of potato filling on each circle of dough. Fold the dough in half and pinch the edges tightly to seal the dumplings.
Cooking the dumplings:
Boiling water: Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add salt.
Cooking the dumplings: Gently drop the dumplings into the boiling water, stirring carefully to prevent sticking. Cook until done (approximately 5-7 minutes after they float to the surface).
Serving:
Removing the dumplings: Remove the dumplings with a slotted spoon and place them on a plate.
Serving: Serve the dumplings hot, optionally drizzling with melted butter, sour cream, or saut√©ed onions.
Enjoy your meal!

Its raid shadow legends,
few things:
make sure you start with a referral link. gives you free stuff.
code monkeyking for a free legendary to help
I'd look up a starter guide on youtube since theres so much youd want to know.
RSL is a very deep game surprisingly. Beneath all the gatcha and cash grabbing, its a very good game, with very deep mechanics. There is always an event going, so you can gain free stuff all the time. 

I've been playing on steam deck, its good. Does well. On pc it lags a lot, but i only go there to check tournaments because they dont load on deck for some reason. 

TLDR: returning players enjoy, new players look up the starter guide on youtube before playing. Youll thank me later.

[Gameplay] üïπÔ∏è

Originally a mobile game, RAID's gameplay is a blend of champion collection and turn-based combat. The strategic depth comes from building synergistic teams for various battles in dungeons, campaigns, and PvP arenas. And you collect sets of gear, artifacts to empower your champions. The game is mostly PvE.

[Graphics] üñºÔ∏è

The game's visuals are a highlight, featuring a dark fantasy art style. Since RAID is originally a mobile game, it won‚Äôt look good on PC graphic-wise.

[Audio] üëÇ

The sound design is OK, with good sound effects and a few cinematic score. I generally play it on mute while doing other stuff.

[Storytelling] ‚úíÔ∏è

The narrative is a classic dark fantasy tale: you are a resurrected warrior fighting to save the realm of Teleria. The lore is expanded through individual character backstories and a cinematic series. Other than that, there is nothing for storytelling.

[Difficulty] üí™

RAID is a gacha game known for its aggressive monetization and a massive grind. While free-to-play is possible, progression can be very slow, and competing at a high level often requires significant spending to acquire top-tier champions. You will spend hours in this game.

Overall I like almost everything about this game. The mythology and the familiar crossovers are specifically cool. I like the randomness less. It makes it difficult to build a specific or 'complete' team even after spending a notable amount of time and money.
Overall, RAID: Shadow Legends is a solid pick if you enjoy turn-based RPGs with large character pools, team building, and strategic battles
In general a very solid game for free, both available modes are really good.

RAID: Shadow Legends ‚Äì A Deep RPG Experience with Strategic Depth

RAID: Shadow Legends offers a rich, turn-based RPG experience set in the dark fantasy world of Teleria. Developed by Plarium, the game boasts over 800 Champions from 15 factions, each with unique abilities and backstories .

Gameplay & Mechanics
The game features a variety of modes including a story-driven campaign, dungeons, faction wars, and PvP arenas. Players can customize their Champions with gear, masteries, and artifacts, allowing for millions of possible builds . The strategic depth is evident as players must consider team compositions, synergy, and tactics to succeed.

Graphics & Performance
RAID impresses with its high-quality 3D graphics and detailed character models, setting a high standard for mobile RPGs. The fantasy-themed art style adds to the immersive experience .

Monetization & Progression
While the game is free-to-play, it includes microtransactions for summoning Champions and acquiring resources. Some players may find the progression system grindy, especially when aiming for top-tier Champions or gear .

Community & Longevity
The game has a dedicated player base and an active esports scene, with tournaments and competitions held regularly. The community is generally welcoming, and the developers continue to support the game with updates, new content, and balance changes .

Final Verdict
RAID: Shadow Legends offers a deep and engaging RPG experience with extensive customization and strategic gameplay. While the monetization model may not appeal to everyone, the game's content and community make it a worthwhile endeavor for RPG enthusiasts.

Rating: 8/10

RAID: Shadow Legends is an impressively polished game that delivers a high-quality RPG experience on both mobile and PC. The graphics are outstanding ‚Äî character models are incredibly detailed, and the animations feel fluid and impactful. The variety of champions is one of the game‚Äôs strongest points, allowing players to build teams that fit any playstyle.

The balance between PvE and PvP modes keeps the gameplay engaging, and there‚Äôs always something to do, whether it‚Äôs progressing through the campaign, tackling dungeons, or competing in the arena. The progression system is rewarding, consistently giving you a sense of growth as you upgrade your champions. Overall, RAID is a great choice for fans of tactical RPGs who enjoy beautiful visuals, strategic combat, and deep hero collection mechanics.

At first I was very skeptical, the youtube ads didn't really make for the best encouragement to play it, but one day I started. It's been 4 years I've been playing this game. I love the fact it's multi-platform, I like very often updates, this game changed so much throughout the years due to the fact more complicated and interested mechanics and COOL champions were introduced. But most of all - I made friends along the way. I've been in 3 clans including the one I'm in now. Each one had the best leadership and other folk were there to always help, not necessarily only about the game. This game has, I think still, bad rep - of course, it is at the end of the day in the very very highest endgame a pay 2 win title - fact is, that most of the players don't aim for the highest ranks in the leaderboards, most of my clanmates are f2p and this game is totally playable this way. It's a one of a kind game - I truly recommend trying it out, multiplatform makes it easier, and getting into a clan is, in my experience, the most fun addition.

Would recommend this game to veteran gamers! Gets too much hate for being pay 2 win which it is but overall the game play and game design is good.

I dont think this game is good for newer gamers as its very predatory and could end up falling victim and emptying your bank account on this game.

This game is time based like farmville, vampire wars .etc - you can only make so much progress in a day. There is no "beating" this game, you can get to the end game entirely free to play but it takes a lot longer than a player who is spending. Spending in this game will get you to the end faster but can be done entirely free to play as well. There is pvp mode and free to play players cannot compete in the end game against spenders but can pretty much do everything else.

I have been playing this game for months and have been enjoying it. If there were better more novel games out i would

RAID: Shadow Legends feels less like a game and more like a grind disguised as RPG. The repetitive missions, heavy reliance on micro‚Äëtransactions, and predictable ‚Äúpay‚Äëto‚Äëwin‚Äù progression make it hard to stay invested, fun only if you don‚Äôt mind shelling out or repeating the same loops over and over.

The developers Plarium Global Ltd have been exposed for paying obscene amounts of money to Chinese bot farms to flood their Steam page with positive reviews.

Terrible game, and Youtubers that take sponsorships for this are part of the problem. Great for people with the attention span of a goldfish, absolutely boring and underwhelming for everyone else.

Full of microtransactions that will burn a hole in your wallet if you're dumb enough to actually buy them for this low effort Chinese mobile game.

Raid: Shadow Legends is still one of the best-looking gacha RPGs out there. The Champion designs and battle animations are top-notch, and the game keeps getting updates that add more content and quality-of-life improvements. The new mechanics in 2025, like the ‚ÄúActivate‚Äù effect and Faction Wars Hard mode, definitely make the gameplay deeper and more strategic.

That said, the difficulty curve has become very steep, and progressing without spending money can feel slow and grindy. Some of the new content is tuned for highly invested players, which might be frustrating if you prefer a more casual pace.

Overall, Raid is a game that rewards patience and strategy. If you enjoy collecting heroes, optimizing teams, and tackling tough challenges, it‚Äôs worth playing. Just be ready for a grind‚Äîand a lot of offers trying to get you to spend.

DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME. At every turn, at every screen, this game wants your money. Constant pop-up's for extreme MACROtransactions. You will NEVER advance, NEVER get any good rewards without giving hundreds of dollars. For the price of just one of their scam deals, you can buy and own so, so, many good games here on Steam. You have been warned. Don't waste your life on this "game"
RAID: Shadow Bullshit is digital cancer. Uninspired, unoriginal, pay-to-win trash. The game everybody heard of (because of its atrocious ad campaigns and shills on YouTube), but nobody likes.

Games fun but DO NOT SPEND MONEY. The worst rates and worst bang for buck I've seen in a gacha. I don't recommend spending a dime because you are likely to be disappointed (like me).

I started for the TMNT event and dropped some cash before realizing how much worse this one is than some of the gacha's I've played in the past. It's very, very predatory... you're constantly saying no to offers. That said, the underlying game if you can get past the marketing is really fun.

Also- if you want to have fun, you really have to spend. There's about a week of decent energy for new players, but once you go to full on free to play... you have to be very efficient. Every resource has a "right" time to spend it, otherwise it's a trap... same goes for deals in the shop if you spend- these are almost ALL traps. Especially for new players.

This is a product first, and a game second.

Spend money:  Only if you are rich!
Not a bad game and I do somewhat enjoy it but the RNG and F2P monetization is brutal.  I wanted something to play, not a second job that wanted me to pay them to work.
While it's graphics are nice, you can see where they get lazy and just reskin the same old models.  Ever notice their hair, how it hovers over their back.  It's a lazy short cut so they can spend more time squeezing more from their cash shop.  That lazy reskin mind set pervades the game.  I don't mind F2P pop up here and there, a game has to make money, but good lord you will get a few dozen by the time you get to the 3 hour daily game expectation their rewards systems sets for you.

If you have a ton of spare time to waste or a fat wallet give the game a try.

Obviously just a pay to win timesink game. It will do it's best to lure you in with deals, and promises while managing to try to pull the rug out from under you. See an add for Alice, get told to enter GETALICE, oh no, it's just for new players though the ad never mentions. Oh you joined a lil' late on a tournament? no dice, you can't get it. You are new to the game, but not new enough to earn rewards? you won't be able to summon the heroes you want. You will be forced to buy something to get even slightly anywhere and even then, you are likely to not get what you want. This game is only as good as the money or time you spend on it. Your time will be far better used on something else, and your money, well that's up to you. They certainly want it all.

This game is not F2P friendly. As a F2P it will take you a while to get anywhere in the game. If you really want to achieve high rewards and returns then you will either need to spend weeks or months of grinding to max each characters as a F2P or P2W and get there instantly after a few MTX transactions. As a F2P you'll be instantly at a disadvantage against those who P2W and even more so against streamers who spend big money.

Be careful about any of the promos that you take advantage of, you're only limited to 1 hero promo code per account. Any future promos that offer a hero as part of the bundle, you'll be instantly disqualified from redeeming said promo. It's sad because this is a missed opportunity for the devs to bring in more players and to also retain F2P players or hero collectors. Sure, you could argue that there is the merge feature but as a F2P, you'll only be able to complete half of the required merge and that would only be Rare and Epic hero merges, you can forget any higher rarity merges. The remainder is either P2W or down to chance which unfortunately, you would have better odds of being struck by lightning than obtaining the heroes you would need to complete the merge.

Once you've completed the main campaign, unless you're a P2W, the game becomes repetitive and boring because the game doesn't expand on the story whilst you complete the exact same campaign on a slightly higher difficulty - It simply ends and makes you repeat it all over again at a slightly higher difficulty than the last, with nothing to add. You can only get so far in dungeons before you hit a difficulty wall. You are then forced to either P2W or grind again to obtain the materials to forge Legendary weaponry/equipment, max each to 16, then obtain the necessary materials to add enchantments, ascend and improve your weaponry to max to progress - There are 9 slots that need to be taken into consideration. Then on top of that, you'll need to spend additional days/weeks grinding to get the applicable summoning crystals. If you're looking for a specific hero for your team/line-up to aid or improve synergy, you'll spend months or years trying to get it due to the randomness and poor rates from said crystals, making you have to repeat the whole process of obtaining crystal once again. Once you've got your chosen hero, you then need to max it, ascend it and add hero perks via scrolls - We're not talking grinding for a couple of days straight, the way the energy recharge is set up, it could take you weeks even months as a F2P just to get past the difficulty wall only to discover you hit the same wall at the next stage or a few stages later. This game really sets you up to be a P2W player -  By the time you've finished your grind, the dungeon has closed and you've lost all will to continue playing the game. Of course, you can P2W and skip all of this BS.

As a P2W it isn't all roses either, from the moment you open the game you have MTX offers rammed down your throat, trying to get more and more money from you and they're not cheap either. To get the line-up/team, equipment, hero perks and ascensions you'd need in the game to even compete with the ranking vs. other players, you'll need to spend a considerable amount of money. Honestly, it would be cheaper to save your money, hire freelancers and develop a competitor game than it would be to pour money into this game.

Visually, the character models aren't great either - Sure, they're better than most games out there but you can tell that this is a port from mobile. There is no option to refine and scale up the graphics for the character models, the Ultra settings only affect the environment models and backgrounds if you're playing on PC. The female characters are hyper-sexualized, not to the scale of other games, so if you're sensitive to that kind of thing, then I wouldn't recommend it.

Raid: Shadow Legends is still one of the best-looking gacha RPGs out there. The Champion designs and battle animations are top-notch, and the game keeps getting updates that add more content and quality-of-life improvements. The new mechanics in 2025, like the ‚ÄúActivate‚Äù effect and Faction Wars Hard mode, definitely make the gameplay deeper and more strategic.

That said, the difficulty curve has become very steep, and progressing without spending money can feel slow and grindy. Some of the new content is tuned for highly invested players, which might be frustrating if you prefer a more casual pace.

Overall, Raid is a game that rewards patience and strategy. If you enjoy collecting heroes, optimizing teams, and tackling tough challenges, it‚Äôs worth playing. Just be ready for a grind‚Äîand a lot of offers trying to get you to spend.

DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME. At every turn, at every screen, this game wants your money. Constant pop-up's for extreme MACROtransactions. You will NEVER advance, NEVER get any good rewards without giving hundreds of dollars. For the price of just one of their scam deals, you can buy and own so, so, many good games here on Steam. You have been warned. Don't waste your life on this "game"
RAID: Shadow Bullshit is digital cancer. Uninspired, unoriginal, pay-to-win trash. The game everybody heard of (because of its atrocious ad campaigns and shills on YouTube), but nobody likes.

Games fun but DO NOT SPEND MONEY. The worst rates and worst bang for buck I've seen in a gacha. I don't recommend spending a dime because you are likely to be disappointed (like me).

I started for the TMNT event and dropped some cash before realizing how much worse this one is than some of the gacha's I've played in the past. It's very, very predatory... you're constantly saying no to offers. That said, the underlying game if you can get past the marketing is really fun.

Also- if you want to have fun, you really have to spend. There's about a week of decent energy for new players, but once you go to full on free to play... you have to be very efficient. Every resource has a "right" time to spend it, otherwise it's a trap... same goes for deals in the shop if you spend- these are almost ALL traps. Especially for new players.

This is a product first, and a game second.

gameplay is very lacking, as it is just clicking buttons and seeing SFX, not to mention the AUTOPLAY BUTTON. 
the monetisation is worse, with payment screens and limited time purchases being thrown at you every time you beat a level. 
beating a level does not feel rewarding in the slightest, only used to pad out playtime.

i purely installed this game to see what it was like, and i did not have high expectations. i was still disappointed.

only good thing is DEATH KNIGHT LETS FUCKING GOOOOOOOO

Thought I'd give this game a try because I'm a fan of Alien and Predator and saw they had a crossover event happening. Thought maybe it'd be like $20 or something crazy for an event pass.

It's $60. 

Lmao.

Obviously just a pay to win timesink game. It will do it's best to lure you in with deals, and promises while managing to try to pull the rug out from under you. See an add for Alice, get told to enter GETALICE, oh no, it's just for new players though the ad never mentions. Oh you joined a lil' late on a tournament? no dice, you can't get it. You are new to the game, but not new enough to earn rewards? you won't be able to summon the heroes you want. You will be forced to buy something to get even slightly anywhere and even then, you are likely to not get what you want. This game is only as good as the money or time you spend on it. Your time will be far better used on something else, and your money, well that's up to you. They certainly want it all.

RAID: Shadow Legends feels less like a game and more like a grind disguised as RPG. The repetitive missions, heavy reliance on micro‚Äëtransactions, and predictable ‚Äúpay‚Äëto‚Äëwin‚Äù progression make it hard to stay invested, fun only if you don‚Äôt mind shelling out or repeating the same loops over and over.

pay to win game, if you have no money in you're bank account, good luck getting at least 2 Legendary champions without having to spend $19.99 or 44.99 to get at least one Sacred shard. the only way to get one champion is being a new new player, or an event we're you HAVE TO PLAY FOR 7 DAYS STRAIGHT to get one legendary.

The developers Plarium Global Ltd have been exposed for paying obscene amounts of money to Chinese bot farms to flood their Steam page with positive reviews.

Terrible game, and Youtubers that take sponsorships for this are part of the problem. Great for people with the attention span of a goldfish, absolutely boring and underwhelming for everyone else.

Full of microtransactions that will burn a hole in your wallet if you're dumb enough to actually buy them for this low effort Chinese mobile game.

Take me back to when they made original cool champions instead of swamping the game with promotional junk.
The whole game is just a sad pool of purely meta builds and of course, the biggest gacha mobile game of all time with more "Pay for this, maybe!?" popups than anything else in existence.

well i cannot do a positive review because there are a paywall terrible, also very hard to summon legendaries, the only legendaries i got was by event, so i dont encourage to spend money in this game, game is good but i care about where other people spend or waste their money so NO....

This game is not F2P friendly. As a F2P it will take you a while to get anywhere in the game. If you really want to achieve high rewards and returns then you will either need to spend weeks or months of grinding to max each characters as a F2P or P2W and get there instantly after a few MTX transactions. As a F2P you'll be instantly at a disadvantage against those who P2W and even more so against streamers who spend big money.

Be careful about any of the promos that you take advantage of, you're only limited to 1 hero promo code per account. Any future promos that offer a hero as part of the bundle, you'll be instantly disqualified from redeeming said promo. It's sad because this is a missed opportunity for the devs to bring in more players and to also retain F2P players or hero collectors. Sure, you could argue that there is the merge feature but as a F2P, you'll only be able to complete half of the required merge and that would only be Rare and Epic hero merges, you can forget any higher rarity merges. The remainder is either P2W or down to chance which unfortunately, you would have better odds of being struck by lightning than obtaining the heroes you would need to complete the merge.

Once you've completed the main campaign, unless you're a P2W, the game becomes repetitive and boring because the game doesn't expand on the story whilst you complete the exact same campaign on a slightly higher difficulty - It simply ends and makes you repeat it all over again at a slightly higher difficulty than the last, with nothing to add. You can only get so far in dungeons before you hit a difficulty wall. You are then forced to either P2W or grind again to obtain the materials to forge Legendary weaponry/equipment, max each to 16, then obtain the necessary materials to add enchantments, ascend and improve your weaponry to max to progress - There are 9 slots that need to be taken into consideration. Then on top of that, you'll need to spend additional days/weeks grinding to get the applicable summoning crystals. If you're looking for a specific hero for your team/line-up to aid or improve synergy, you'll spend months or years trying to get it due to the randomness and poor rates from said crystals, making you have to repeat the whole process of obtaining crystal once again. Once you've got your chosen hero, you then need to max it, ascend it and add hero perks via scrolls - We're not talking grinding for a couple of days straight, the way the energy recharge is set up, it could take you weeks even months as a F2P just to get past the difficulty wall only to discover you hit the same wall at the next stage or a few stages later. This game really sets you up to be a P2W player -  By the time you've finished your grind, the dungeon has closed and you've lost all will to continue playing the game. Of course, you can P2W and skip all of this BS.

As a P2W it isn't all roses either, from the moment you open the game you have MTX offers rammed down your throat, trying to get more and more money from you and they're not cheap either. To get the line-up/team, equipment, hero perks and ascensions you'd need in the game to even compete with the ranking vs. other players, you'll need to spend a considerable amount of money. Honestly, it would be cheaper to save your money, hire freelancers and develop a competitor game than it would be to pour money into this game.

Visually, the character models aren't great either - Sure, they're better than most games out there but you can tell that this is a port from mobile. There is no option to refine and scale up the graphics for the character models, the Ultra settings only affect the environment models and backgrounds if you're playing on PC. The female characters are hyper-sexualized, not to the scale of other games, so if you're sensitive to that kind of thing, then I wouldn't recommend it.
